references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the field of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs), introducing the now widely used Graph Convolutional Network (GCN) architecture.

references.paper_title: Predict then propagate: Graph neural networks meet personalized pagerank
references.reason: This work introduced a novel approach to training deeper GNNs by combining prediction and propagation steps, addressing the over-smoothing problem.

references.paper_title: Representation learning on graphs with jumping knowledge networks
references.reason: This paper proposed the Jumping Knowledge Networks (JKNets) architecture, a significant advancement in training deep GNNs by using a different aggregation technique.

references.paper_title: Deeper insights into graph convolutional networks for semi-supervised learning
references.reason: This work provided valuable insights into the over-smoothing problem inherent in deep GNNs, motivating the development of solutions like residual connections.
This paper introduced a normalization technique, PairNorm, to mitigate the over-smoothing issue, directly impacting the design of residual connections in GNNs.
